title: 袁弓夷：有手足想去美國參軍

replies.msg:
https://youtu.be/OBq2V6YTxlg?t=2870s

岩岩見到佢講
佢都話唔建議直接參軍
想去美國參軍既手足，麻煩聽聽我講：

如果真係想參軍，讀好D書先
你要想像美軍係一間公司，
你資歷唔夠既話，就算人地公司比你入你都只係會做清潔工人

諗長遠D，就算光復香港之後，你出番黎都好可能會失業（美國大把Homeless Vet）

讀好D書，做專業人士，夠Sharp醒，入airforce或者其他專業，光復香港之後番黎做教頭，貢獻仲大

唔好咁傻直接衝入去Recruitment Office做infantry打中共

利申有朋友係vet
讀好D書先

推
袁弓夷肯幫手鋪路係好事

但係唔好做美軍水魚

replies.msg:
Alright, what you said about the infantry pisses me off.

There are 7 war fighting functions in the Army: command and control, fires, force protection, information, intelligence, logistics, and maneuver. They are all designed to support combat arms units. We need infantry to secure, clear, gain, and hold grounds.

I have met infantry soldiers with master’s degree and still chose to stay enlisted in the Infantry. I enlisted in the national guard infantry when I was 19, got out, used my GI Bill for my master’s, commissioned, went back in and I am still in the Infantry. My platoon sergeant now, who have not finished his bachelors degree, is making over $91,000 a year. There are aviators started their careers in the Infantry, made E6, went to WOC school and went on to become Apache Pilots.

We do offer opportunities for higher education of one chooses to, but if you don’t, you can still make a decent living in the Army. If you apply yourself, opportunities are endless. Bottom line is “apply yourself!!!”

For those who went homeless, either they chose not to apply themselves after the Army, or we as an Army failed to inform them or set them up for success.

Stop with this nonsense looking down on others. If they work hard and choose to contribute with the best of their ability? They deserves our respect.

美國反共智囊余茂春

美國海軍學院東亞和軍事史教授，美國國務院國務卿政策規劃辦公室中國政策規劃首席顧問，曾擔任《華盛頓時報》專欄作家。

獲得重慶市永川中學文科狀元，並考入南開大學[2]。重慶永川文曲廣場有碑，碑銘歷屆高考狀元的姓名。原來有余茂春，後被剷除，原因不詳。

在南開大學，余茂春認為學習大學必修的辯證唯物主義和教條式的歷史觀是浪費時間。通過收聽美國之音，余茂春受到了美國總統里根演講的啟發，產生了前往美國的意圖。1983年，畢業於南開大學歷史系。

1985年到美國留學，進入賓夕法尼亞斯沃斯莫爾學院，獲得碩士[3]。1989年中國六四事件後積極參與民主活動，並幫助逃離中國的學生在美國洛杉磯定居。他舉辦中國論壇，幫助包括吳弘達和方勵之在內的持不同政見者發聲。[1]1994年，在加州大學伯克利分校獲得歷史學博士學位後，進入美國海軍學院任教，擔任東亞和軍事史教授，所教學生為數百位美國海軍軍官，其中不少人後來進入美國國務院和國防部工作，至今仍稱他為「余教授」。[4]。

Alright, what you said about the infantry pisses me off.

There are 7 war fighting functions in the Army: command and control, fires, force protection, information, intelligence, logistics, and maneuver. They are all designed to support combat arms units. We need infantry to secure, clear, gain, and hold grounds.

I have met infantry soldiers with master’s degree and still chose to stay enlisted in the Infantry. I enlisted in the national guard infantry when I was 19, got out, used my GI Bill for my master’s, commissioned, went back in and I am still in the Infantry. My platoon sergeant now, who have not finished his bachelors degree, is making over $91,000 a year. There are aviators started their careers in the Infantry, made E6, went to WOC school and went on to become Apache Pilots.

We do offer opportunities for higher education of one chooses to, but if you don’t, you can still make a decent living in the Army. If you apply yourself, opportunities are endless. Bottom line is “apply yourself!!!”

For those who went homeless, either they chose not to apply themselves after the Army, or we as an Army failed to inform them or set them up for success.

Stop with this nonsense looking down on others. If they work hard and choose to contribute with the best of their ability? They deserves our respect.

Alright, what you said about the infantry pisses me off.

There are 7 war fighting functions in the Army: command and control, fires, force protection, information, intelligence, logistics, and maneuver. They are all designed to support combat arms units. We need infantry to secure, clear, gain, and hold grounds.

I have met infantry soldiers with master’s degree and still chose to stay enlisted in the Infantry. I enlisted in the national guard infantry when I was 19, got out, used my GI Bill for my master’s, commissioned, went back in and I am still in the Infantry. My platoon sergeant now, who have not finished his bachelors degree, is making over $91,000 a year. There are aviators started their careers in the Infantry, made E6, went to WOC school and went on to become Apache Pilots.

We do offer opportunities for higher education of one chooses to, but if you don’t, you can still make a decent living in the Army. If you apply yourself, opportunities are endless. Bottom line is “apply yourself!!!”

For those who went homeless, either they chose not to apply themselves after the Army, or we as an Army failed to inform them or set them up for success.

Stop with this nonsense looking down on others. If they work hard and choose to contribute with the best of their ability? They deserves our respect.
